page.title: 02GEOGRAPHY OF THE AREA 1/2
page.content:
Tedburn St. Mary lies in beautiful countryside which is mainly given over to pasture land; the contours of the undulating landscape, on average, range between 100m and 200m.
The largest stand of trees is Oldridge wood. Several other plantations and copses exist especially along the courses of the river Ted and Lillybrook.
Several present day farms were Domesday Manors. Examples are Great Hackworthy and Uppacott. Some field patterns which suggest the characteristic open medieval field patterns which were laid out in strips, are evident in the vicinity of Uppacott.
